pr_title: feat: [DHIS2-8326] Run program rule engine in importer for notification rules

timeline.message: Run program rule engine in importer for notification rules

timeline.bodyText: In legacy importer, this was handled by async spring event. But this is synchronous and it will probably slow down the new tracker importer unless we make ProgramRuleEngine more performant.
timeline.author: zubaira

replies.bodyText:
After a chat with Zubair I think we agreed that we are focusing on the functionality now.
Anyway, the loop to get the enrollment and event rules is done using parallel stream.
To really improve performance in the future we will need to refactor rule-engine to accept multiple entities that share the same context.
replies.author: enricocolasante

replies.bodyText: Hi, if the code is no longer async, do we need to keep the @TransactionalEventListener annotation on ProgramRuleEngineListener?
replies.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText:
I think that when the new importer is working, we could completely remove the listener from the code.
In the legacy importer it should work as an async listener.
replies.author: enricocolasante

timeline.message: Add test calling rule engine for events
Fix antlr grammar and make the project independent from dhis

timeline.bodyText: The interface now uses objects and long, which is a bit confusing. I normally favour primary keys as function parameters: when using Hibernate there is no overhead anyway, because the object is normally in the first level cache, so the additional lookup is free.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText:
Changed to use long and String.
We need to use the id in the listener, because is how the event is created and from the importer I do not have the id (at least in a simple way), so we would use the UID
replies.author: enricocolasante

timeline.bodyText: Just make sure when using parallelStream that the objects the system is iterating over do not need to lazily access the db. Proxies need a Hibernate Session to access the db lazily, but Session is not thread-safe and you'll end up with very weird, random errors.
timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio

replies.bodyText:
Good catch.
Removed parallelStream, we will need to improve the code to build the context to call rule-engine for all the events/enrollments and then maybe use parallelStream to make the calls to rule-engine library
replies.author: enricocolasante

timeline.author: luciano-fiandesio
